newsitem.title: USA: Norwest Corp agrees to acquire Texas bank.
newsitem.headline: Norwest Corp agrees to acquire Texas bank.

text.p: Norwest Corp said Monday it signed a definitive agreement to acquire First Valley Bank Group, which has $447 million in assets and has 18 banking stores throughout the Rio Grande Valley.
Terms of the transaction were not disclosed.

"As a strong community bank with a commitment to maintaining the highest possible standards for customers, First Valley Bank Group is a natural fit for Norwest," John Stumpf, regional president for Norwest Banks in Texas, said in a statement.
When the transaction is completed, Cleve Breedlove, chairman and chief executive officer of First Valley Bank Group, will be chairman of Norwest Banks in the Rio Grande Valley.
Norwest Banks in Texas include 158 banking stores in 84 communities and total assets of $9.4 billion.
